Sentence.sentence: They also, however, use far more natural resources—fuel, water ( ' , all those baths and golf courses) and building materials.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For almost five centuries a very large supply of cod ( ' ,  鳕 鱼) provided abundant raw material for an industry which at its peak employed about 40,000 people, sustaining entire communities in Newfoundland.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Asked what they would like to change in the world, the students mentioned only personal concerns such as slowing down the pace of life, gaining good friends, becoming more spiritual, becoming either more materially successful or less materially oriented ( ' , depending on the student's values), and being more respectful of the Earth, animals and other people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But numerous studies have now found that when classroom material is made harder to absorb, pupils retain more of it over the long term, and understand it on a deeper level.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rather, it's better to let the learners wrestle (较劲）with the material on their own for a while, refraining from giving them any assistance at the start
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Nearly all application materials are submitted online, and the Common Application provides a one-size-fits form accepted by more than 400 schools, including the nation's most selective.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Producers of agricultural goods and raw materials.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The very process imposed a limitation on the quantity of materials copied.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Replace the shirt with one of some other material.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Another team at Nagoya University in Japan has tested calcium compound as an energy storage material.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: For almost five centuries a very large supply of cod provided abundant raw material for an industry which at its peak employed about 40,000 people, sustaining entire communities in Newfoundland.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: So now, the main challenge was to find the right material for printing clothes with, I mean the material you feed the printer with.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Surfing the Internet during class doesn't just steal focus from the educator; it also hurts students who're already struggling to grasp the material.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读

Sentence.sentence: The breakthrough came when I was introduced to Fila Flex, which is a new kind of printing material.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: This means minors enjoy material benefits and legal protections that would have been the envy of those living in the past.

Sentence.sentence: Unfortunately, pieces of science journalism can also oversimplify and generalize their subject material to the point that the basic information conveyed is obscured or at worst, obviously wrong.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"物质，东西"之意。
means: material ： 通常指组成客观存在物的部分或其原料。
matter ： 通常指构成实物的物质，与精神相对立。在科学上，指占有空间，并能以某种方式被感官觉察的一切东西。
substance ： 多指某一种形式的物质，既可指元素也可指化合物。
stuff ： 多用于日常生活中，非正式用词。常指构成整体的所有部分、物体或项目。有时指劣等材料，含轻蔑意味。

Sentence.sentence: Animals are built of many different materials----skin, fat, and more----and light moves through each at a different speed.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: At the university of Cambridge Turin discovered a wealth of important materials-including photographs, films, tape recordings, and field notes—which had remained unstudied and were badly in need of care and protection.

Sentence.sentence: But some materials slow and scatter (散射) light, bouncing it away from its original path.

Sentence.sentence: Every time light moves into a material with a new speed, it bends and scatters.

Sentence.sentence: Experimenting with materials to create something new can go a long way in helping them develop their creativity.

Sentence.sentence: Humans are unique in their capacity to not only make tools but then turn around and use them to create superfluous material goods - paintings, sculpture and architecture - and superfluous experiences - music, literature, religion and philosophy.

Sentence.sentence: Even after the advent of widespread social media, a pyramid of production remains, with a small number of people uploading material, a slightly larger group commenting on or modifying that content, and a huge percentage remaining content to just consume.

Sentence.sentence: In most of the homeless gardens of New York City the actual cultivation of plants is unfeasible, yet even so the compositions often seem to represent attempts to call arrangement of materials, an institution of colors, small pool of water, and a frequent presence of petals or leaves as well as of stuffed animals.

Sentence.sentence: Here was the raw material of houses and furniture, ships and potash, dyes and naval stores.

Sentence.sentence: Rather, we ascribe meanings to test on the basis of interaction between what we might call textual and contextual material: between kinds of organization or patterning we perceive in a text’s formal structures ( ' , so especially its language structures) and various kinds of background, social knowledge, belief and attitude that we bring to the text.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

means.word_mean: 材料, 原料

sentences.en: Japan imports textile materials from Britain.
sentences.cn: 日本从英国进口纺织材料。

means.word_mean: 衣料

sentences.en: She never wears clothes made of coarse material.
sentences.cn: 她从来不穿粗布衣服。

means.word_mean: 素材, 资料

sentences.en: During my three months' stay in the village, I collected enough material for two or three books.
sentences.cn: 我在村里待了三个月, 搜集的材料足够写两三本书。

means.word_mean: 布料
节目；曲目；剧目
[复数]用具；设备
【哲学】 物质；质料
物质的; 身体的; 肉体的

sentences.en: She is too poor to satisfy her family's material needs.
sentences.cn: 她太穷了, 无法满足家人的物质需要。

means.word_mean: 重要的, 重大的

sentences.en: The prosecution's case collapsed when a material witness failed to appear in court.
sentences.cn: 一名重要的证人没有出庭, 因此诉讼辩论无法进行。

means.word_mean: 物欲的；追求实利的；世俗的
以经验为根据的
【法律】 对案件有决定性影响的
【哲学】 物质的；物质性的；非精神的</seg>

data.mean: 物质的，实际的（非精神需求的）
素材；用以创作的材料（或构想）

sentence.cn: 用原材料制造产品会产生更多的废料，甚至是成品所含废料的100倍。
sentence.en: Creating products out of raw materials creates much more waste material, up to 100 times more, than the material contained in the finished products.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

sentence.cn: 因此，您需要花一个小时的时间，与某人进行一对一的面对面交流，他们将帮助您掌握材料，并提高成绩。
sentence.en: So hoof on over to an office hour and have some one-on-one face time with someone who’ll help you master the material and improve your grade,  to boot.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

means.word_mean: 物质;原料;货物
其他释义
物质的;肉体的

example.ex: ...electrons in a conducting material such as a metal.
example.tran: 金属等导电材料中的电子
新型高吸水性材料的设计

example.ex: The materials are soft and comfortable to wear.
example.tran: 这些布料质地柔软，穿着很舒服。

entry.def: Materials are the things that you need for a particular activity.

example.ex: The builders ran out of materials.

entry.def: Ideas or information that are used as a basis for a book, play, or film can be referred to as material .

example.ex: In my version of the story, I added some new material.
example.tran: 我在讲述这个故事时加入了新的素材。

example.ex: ...the film producer's debt to the author of original screen material.
example.tran: 影片的制片人受到了创作影片原始素材的作者的启发

entry.def: Material things are related to possessions or money, rather than to more abstract things such as ideas or values.
entry.tran: （指与抽象相对）物质的，有形的，实体的

example.ex: Every room must have been stuffed with material things.
example.tran: 每个房间肯定都塞满了东西。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of material, you mean that they have the qualities or abilities to do a particular job or task.

example.ex: His message has changed little since he became presidential material.
example.tran: 成为总统候选人后，他的宣言并没有多少变化。

entry.def: Material evidence or information is directly relevant and important in a legal or academic argument.
entry.tran: (证据或信息)直接相关的，实质性的，重要的

example.ex: The nature and availability of material evidence was not to be discussed...
example.tran: 实质性证据的性质和可用性毋庸讨论。

example.ex: They contend that the company failed to disclose material information.
example.tran: 他们坚持认为该公司并未透露实质性的信息。

means.word_mean: 1. the tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object;

sentences.sentence: "wheat is the stuff they use to make bread"

means.word_mean: 2. information (data or ideas or observations) that can be used or reworked into a finished form;

sentences.sentence: "the archives provided rich material for a definitive biography"

means.word_mean: 3. things needed for doing or making something;
4. artifact made by weaving or felting or knitting or crocheting natural or synthetic fibers;

sentences.sentence: "the fabric in the curtains was light and semitraqnsparent"
"woven cloth originated in Mesopotamia around 5000 BC"
"she measured off enough material for a dress"

means.word_mean: 5. a person judged suitable for admission or employment;
1. concerned with worldly rather than spiritual interests;
2. derived from or composed of matter;
3. directly relevant to a matter especially a law case;

sentences.sentence: "evidence material to the issue at hand"
"facts likely to influence the judgment are called material facts"

means.word_mean: 4. concerned with or affecting physical as distinct from intellectual or psychological well-being;

sentences.sentence: "the moral and material welfare of all good citizens"- T.Roosevelt

means.word_mean: 5. having material or physical form or substance;

sentences.sentence: "that which is created is of necessity corporeal and visible and tangible" - Benjamin Jowett

means.word_mean: 6. having substance or capable of being treated as fact; not imaginary;

sentences.sentence: "a mere dream, neither substantial nor practical"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'relating to matter'): from late Latin materialis, adjective from Latin materia 'matter'

sentences.cn: 近五个世纪以来，鳕鱼的大量供给为渔业提供了丰富的原材料，使该行业在巅峰时期雇用了约40,000 人，足以维持整个纽芬兰岛人民的生活。

sentences.cn: 但是，这些公民也使用着更多的自然资源——包括燃料、水（那些洗浴用水和高尔夫球场用水也全部包括在内）以及建筑材料。
sentences.en: They also, however, use far more natural resources—fuel, water (all those baths and golf courses) and building materials.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 研究人员还指出，准备共享数据以供他人查看的过程需要耗费很多时间。一旦数据和相关材料出现在存储库，答疑和处理投诉就会花费大量时间。
sentences.en: I) Researchers also point to the time sink that is involved in preparing data for others to view. Once the data and associated materials appear in a repository answering questions and handling complaints can take many hours.
sentences.from: 17年12月六级真题(第二套)| 阅读

sentences.cn: 所以现在主要的问题就是找到合适的打印材料，我是指放入打印机的材料。

sentences.cn: 所以我认为未来材料会逐步发展，外观和触感将变得像我们现在所熟知的棉花和丝绸等纤维材料那样。
